column4: I have only one login password
even when I want to go to console I use the same password as root
when I want to shutdown the system It ask me for password before I can shut it down
when I put the password it refuse to shotdown, iut display wrong password
Is there a special password in ubuntu beside the root password that I don't know?
do you have the root account enabled or are you using sudo normally ?
the root account is locked by default login using the account you created during install and use sudo for root access.
sudo -s (enter your user password) and you basically have a root terminal
I drop to Root/Console I type "sudo -u root it still don't work
yes it will ask for your password, enter your user password
right click the one you don't want and delete it
you can add a window list to the top panel by right clicking the panel and selecting "add to panel"
you probably will want to add a workspace switcher to the top bar as well
